textWithDelay.text: Hi!
I am the developer who made this game
…Why? Is it different from what you expected?
Aren't developers usually not directly in the game?
Well... can't I appear a little in the game I made?
Later, it’ll be hard to see me, so enjoy while you can~
So, what are we going to do now?

If you came to play the game,
I should teach you how, right?

Tutorial... no, we’ll start with learning how to walk!
It's not that hard.
Come on~ try scrolling the screen lightly once.

How is it? Simple, right? You can move
with just one finger~
Alright, now stop.

Don’t wander around and later complain
that you didn’t hear the explanation properly.
Let me explain where you are.

The place you're in right now is my space
that you share with 194 other friends.
They all have different colors, sizes, and more, but they’re all made by me, so no fighting!
Let’s see.... now I should give you a task.

Alright then... as a developer,
the first mission I’ll give you is...
Find the yellow ball with a red star in the center!
That’s really it. Simple, right?

Since it’s your first time,
I’ll show you an image below as a special hint.

See it at the bottom left?
Find one that looks just like this.
Try wandering around and looking for it.
What, you were just supposed to find it—did you go ahead and press play too?
I was going to explain from there again...
Well, anyway, good job.

You might suddenly think,
‘Why am I even doing this?’

But everything will have its purpose later,
so for now, just do it and get used to the controls.

You know what to do this time too, right?
Find the yellow ball with the red star.
That ball guides you to the next stage, so whenever you're unsure, just look for it.
Oh, and here’s one hint.

The yellow ball you’re looking for
is within the grid lines.

Don’t go wandering into the dark areas and struggling—
just search within the grid lines.
How is it? Not too hard, right?
Hey~ Honestly, it's still manageable, right? Haha
Well... anyway, this is all that's prepared for now...
...Now it's time to really begin.
Everyone, pay attention!
You all know that the code I made is embedded inside you, right?
It was originally perfect code... but due to some circumstances, a problem occurred.
So right now, you're in an incomplete state...
Anyway, I'll go fix the code, so wait here.
I'll be back as soon as it's fixed, so don't do anything else, just wait for the code.
It will make you complete.
Oh, and the most important thing...
No matter what happens, until I come back, you must never, ever discard the code embedded inside you.
The code is my DNA, and it's a kind of certification that you belong to me.
What happens if you discard it?
The moment you discard it, you will lose your original color and turn pitch black, and then...
You won't even be able to move by yourself, like you are now.
How is it? You definitely shouldn't discard it, right?
So, once again, I say, never discard the code, absolutely never.
I'll be back soon.
You saw it earlier too, right?
It takes 6000 years to fix the code, haha.

Even at this very moment, in your world,
the 6000-year countdown is probably happening.

We're bored, so let's do something,
we can't wait for 6000 years.
Hmm... let's see...
Something you might find fun...
Ah! Do you know this?

People make an average of
35,000 decisions a day.
Let's calculate that.

That means they make
1458.3 decisions an hour...
24.3 decisions per minute.
Once every 2.5 seconds.
On average, a person makes a decision once every 2.5 seconds.

Well, if you include the time spent sleeping,
it seems to be roughly correct, right?
Let's increase the units.

35,000 decisions a day means
140,000 decisions a week.
600,000 decisions a month.

7,300,000 decisions a year
730,000,000 decisions in 100 years.
43,800,000,000 decisions in 6000 years.

Oh... humans make
43.8 billion decisions in 6000 years?
Now, let's see...

How many decisions do you think your smartphone
makes per second?

Well... each phone is different,
but on average...
It can make about 85 million decisions per second.

In other words, the phone you’re holding
can do what humans take 6000 years for in just 515 seconds.
What I’m trying to say is...
Even now, the real-world time is ticking second by second,
while the time in the mobile game you're holding is different.

Let’s see...
6000 years vs 515 seconds...

In the game world, every 2,126,022,472 seconds
is equivalent to just 1 second in the real world.

So in the real world, 1 second is
67.38 years in the game.

Now, how many seconds in your reality
would equal the 6000 years the game character has to wait?
89 seconds is enough.
How many seconds have passed now?
Yeah... just you left...

You must have been lonely,
but you held on to the code till the end. Great job.
It seems like it’s time for your eyes to open.
Now, open your eyes.
